revised_title: Configuration Interaction Effects on Atomic Hyperfine Structure
tldr: This article investigates the effects of configuration interaction on atomic hyperfine structure using second-order perturbation theory. The study focuses on configurations where only specific electrons are not in closed shells. The results are consistent with experimental data for the shell, and the analysis considers the excitation of electrons in different scenarios. The article also discusses the core polarization effect and the use of effective operators to reproduce configuration interaction effects.
